business.headline: TCS layoff: What the company is offering to 12,000 affected employeesTCS job cut: The move is part of a broader plan to adapt to changing technology trends and streamline operations as the company aims to become a "future-ready" organisation.

We negotiate confidently: Minister's signal to US after landmark UK trade pactIndia has signed a landmark free trade agreement with the UK, marking a new phase in bilateral economic ties. The government aims to use this momentum to secure future deals with the US and other key partners.

A will, a letter, and a brewing dispute: Sunjay Kapur's mother vs Sona ComstarAs Sunjay Kapur's mother takes on Sona Comstar, the unfolding dispute could shape into a high-stakes clash of legacy, legality, and loss in one of India's storied business families.

Joint home loan or personal loan? What's smarter for young couples buying propertyBuying your first home as a couple is exciting, but figuring out how to finance it? That's where things get tricky. Should you go for a joint home loan or take a personal loan? Let's break it down.

How taxes drove Formula 1 out of IndiaFormula 1 didn't leave India because of a lack of fans or infrastructure. It left because of unclear policies, tax confusion, and a system that didn't treat it like a sport.

Meta hires ChatGPT co-creator as chief scientist to lead new AI labMeta has appointed ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao as chief scientist of its new Superintelligence Lab, aiming to advance AGI and regain AI leadership after Llama 4's weak performance.

Explained: Why India-UK free trade agreement is a big deal for both nationsIndia and the United Kingdom have formally sealed a Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, a deal described as the "biggest, most economically significant trade deal that the UK has made since leaving the EU."

Not a shareholder, no coercion: Sunjay Kapur's firm counters mother's chargesThe clarification comes after it was reported that Rani Kapur had written a letter to delay the AGM and alleged that she was made to sign documents shortly after her son's death.

Remainers will choke on their cornflakes: British media hails India trade dealThe India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) or the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) seeks to enhance bilateral trade by around USD 34 billion annually, besides ensuring better market access.

FTAs with EU, US in talks, says Commerce Secretary after India-UK trade dealThe agreement now needs to pass through both houses of the British Parliament. A special committee will study it before giving final approval.

Everyone wants to be an influencer. But can it pay the bills?The creator economy in India is booming, but the economics remain shaky. What started as a hobby or side hustle for many is now a full-time hustle, and an increasingly competitive one.

Sensex ends 721 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Bajaj Finance falls 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 721.08 points to 81,463.09 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 225.10 points to trade at 24,837.

Sunjay Kapur's mother alleges business coercion, attempt to 'usurp family legacy'Rani Kapur has publicly objected to what she calls an "inappropriate and premature" AGM, held during a period of deep mourning, and raised serious concerns over how decisions are being made in the aftermath.

This key agreement in UK trade deal will hugely benefit Indian firms, workersOne of the key parts of the India-UK trade deal is the introduction of the Double Contribution Convention (DCC), which is expected to help Indian professionals working in the UK by reducing their social security burden.

Filing ITR under old regime? Claim these 5 home loan tax benefits If you are sticking to the old tax regime this year, make sure you don't miss out on the big tax savings your home loan can offer. Here are five home loan benefits you must know for your ITR.

Who has to file ITR by when? All 2025 deadlines explainedFiling your ITR on time can save you from paying extra penalties. But not everyone has the same deadline this year. Here's a quick look at who must file by when for the 2025 cycle.

Sensex tumbles over 700 points: Why stock markets are in the red today The benchmark S&P BSE Sensex fell 624.64 points to 81,559.53 by 10:41 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 215.85 points to 24,846.25.

Explained: Why IEX share price gained 11% todayIEX stock opened at Rs 137.00 today, higher than the previous close of Rs 132.45. It climbed further to touch a high of Rs 149.45 in morning trade. As of 9:37 am, the share was trading at Rs 146.80, up 10.84%.

Explained: Why Bajaj Finance shares tumbled 6% despite strong Q1 resultsThe Bajaj Finance stock was down 5.42% at Rs 907 on the BSE at around 9:28 am, while Bajaj Finserv also fell nearly 5%. Bajaj Finance touched an intraday low of Rs 898.10, marking a 6.3% decline.

NSDL IPO: Check price band, GMP, key dates, issue size and moreThe IPO, a pure offer for sale, aims to raise Rs 4,011 crore. It will open for subscription on July 30 and close on August 1, with anchor bids starting a day earlier on July 29.

Sensex falls 300 points at opening, Nifty below 25,000; Bajaj Finance tanks 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 389.42 points to 81,794.75, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 133.70 points to 24,928.40 as of 9:25 am.

IEX stock: Indian Energy Exchange shares to be in focus today. Here's whyIEX shares fell sharply on Thursday, July 24. The stock dropped as much as 28% and touched a 52-week low of Rs 135.26 on the BSE.
Intel layoffs: 25,000 roles at risk as company braces for big reset, says reportIn a letter to employees, Intel's new CEO Lip-Bu Tan acknowledged the difficult period the company is going through.

Why Donald Trump doesn't want Google, Microsoft to hire IndiansSpeaking at an AI Summit in Washington on Wednesday, Donald Trump said American companies must now put national interest first, especially in the fast-growing field of artificial intelligence.

Kristin Cabot, Astronomer HR head, resigns after viral Coldplay kiss-cam scandalAstronomer's HR chief Kristin Cabot resigned days after being caught on a Coldplay kiss-cam with CEO Andy Byron, who also stepped down earlier amid the viral scandal and public backlash.

Billionaire behind your browser: Sundar Pichai's net worth crosses $1 billionAlphabet stock has returned around 120% to investors since 2023 and is now trading close to its all-time high. This has benefited top executives, including Sundar Pichai.

India-UK free trade deal: How the deal could boost bilateral tradeThe deal is expected to provide greater market access for Indian products and services, while UK companies, particularly in sectors like automobiles and medical equipment, will also benefit from reduced tariffs.

Why some purchases are priceless: Startup founder on spending and living wellWe often treat money decisions like maths problems, but this startup founder says some buys, like a family car or your own home, bring wealth you can't count.

PM Modi in UK for FTA: Cheaper scotch and cars on cardsPrime Minister Narendra Modi is in the UK for a meeting with the UK Prime Minister and is also expected to meet King Charles III, with the India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) being the main focus. This agreement is set to provide significant market access to Indian sectors like fisheries, textiles, gems, jewellery, and leather, with a potential market size of $5.2 billion in the UK for the fisheries sector alone.

Money matters, but joy matters more: Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta's mantra for lifeMany young earners feel constant pressure to save every rupee for the future. It's common to hear advice about building a fat retirement fund or aiming for the highest returns. But Radhika Gupta wants people to know that money is only useful if it also makes your present better.

Whisky, chocolates, cars: What gets cheaper for Indians after UK trade dealThe trade agreement was signed by India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and the UK's Secretary of State for Business and Trade, Jonathan Reynolds.

Sensex ends 542 points lower, Nifty below 25,100 as volatility weighs heavyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 542.47 points lower at 82,184.17, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 157.80 points to close at 25,062.10. Selling pressure was visible across sectors, with FMCG, IT, and financial stocks dragging the indices down.

Small shopkeepers are turning away from UPI paymentsAccording to the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI saw over 14.04 billion transactions in June 2024. Yet, for many at the grassroots, the system seems too complex and risky to fully embrace.
ED raids hit Anil Ambani stocks: Reliance Power, Infra sink 5%Reliance Infrastructure has lost 9.37% in the past five trading sessions, Reliance Power has fallen by 7.41% during the same period.

Filed the wrong ITR form? Here's how to fix it to avoid penaltyMany taxpayers only spot mistakes after hitting 'Submit'. Filing the wrong form can snowball into bigger headaches later, from refund delays to unexpected penalties. But tax experts say you do have ways to set things right, provided you act quickly.

Sensex plunges 600 points. Why is the stock market down today?The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 592.85 points to 82,133.79 by 1:04 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 169.25 points to 25,050.65. All broader market indices were in the red as market sentiment weakened.

EPFO now on DigiLocker: See how it helps youThe government has been making several digital changes for EPFO members in the last few months. This new feature on DigiLocker is another step to make your provident fund details more accessible.

Loan, lies and bribery? Why Anil Ambani is facing ED heatMultiple agencies, including the National Housing Bank, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), the National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA), and Bank of Baroda shared findings and inputs that contributed to the investigation.
India-UK FTA: What's on the table in landmark $34 billion deal?For Indian businesses, the FTA opens up wider access to British markets by slashing tariffs and easing compliance.

entertainment.headline: Raveena Tandon confirms Aranyak Season 2 shelved, says script didn't work outRaveena Tandon has confirmed that season 2 of her hit web series Aranyak is not happening, despite initial hopes and a written script. She shared that the makers couldn't crack a script that matched the high expectations set by the first season.

Ankita Lokhande shares emotional note with Vicky Jain ahead of Laughter Chefs finaleAs 'Laughter Chefs' Season 2 comes to an end, actor Ankita Lokhande shared a emotional note with husband Vicky Jain, thanking fans and the show's team for all the love. She called the show a fun journey that felt like therapy for everyone involved.

Rashmika Mandanna begins Mysaa shooting in Hyderabad, see muhurat picsRashmika Mandanna is set to headline 'Mysaa', a female-led pan-India action thriller rooted in the culture of the Gond tribes. The shooting is set to begin soon with the muhurat ceremony in Hyderabad on July 27.

Salman Khan shares life lesson from father Salim: Wish I heard this earlierSalman Khan shared a heartfelt life lesson from his father Salim Khan, reflecting on how past actions shape one's future and character. He expressed regret over not understanding the advice earlier.

Fantastic Four box office Day 2: Marvel film sees mild growth after slow startMarvel's 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' had a slow start at the Indian box office, earning Rs 12.60 crore nett in two days despite global success.

Rashmika Mandanna cheers for Kingdom trailer, Vijay's reply steals heartsVijay Deverakonda's upcoming spy thriller 'Kingdom' has received strong praise from Rashmika Mandanna, who called the trailer 'madness' and lauded his acting. The film will release in theatres on July 31.

Dhanush and GV Prakash jam together ahead of Idly Kadai single release. WatchA video of Dhanush and music composer GV Prakash jamming ahead of the 'Idly Kadai' single release has gone viral, adding to the excitement for the film's music.

My little princess: AR Rahman celebrates daughter Raheema's graduationAR Rahman recently celebrated his daughter Raheema's graduation. The singer posted pictures from the ceremony in Switzerland.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 3: Pawan Kalyan's film faces weekend slumpPawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' saw a sharp decline at the box office on Day 3, earning Rs 9.25 crore nett after a strong Rs 34 crore nett opening.

GoT star Nikolaj Coster-Waldau savours idli at Bengaluru's Rameshwaram Cafe. Watch'Game of Thrones' actor Nikolaj Coster-Waldau surprised Indian fans as he was clicked enjoying South Indian cuisine at Bengaluru's popular Rameshwaram Cafe. Several videos and pictures of his trip have gone viral.

Actor Vineet Kumar, wife Ruchiraa welcome baby boy: He's already stealing heartsActor Vineet Kumar Singh and wife  Ruchiraa Gormaray have been blessed with a baby boy. The 'Chhaava' actor announced the news on social media.

Priyanka-Nick enjoy BLACKPINK's New York concert, dance to APT. WatchPriyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas attended BLACKPINK's concert in New York, sharing fun moments from the event on social media. Chopra praised Lisa as a queen.

Kingdom trailer: Vijay Deverakonda embarks on deadly mission as an undercover spyThe trailer of 'Kingdom' starring Vijay Deverakonda in the lead is out. The action-entertainer will release in theatres on July 31.

Parag Tyagi posts emotional tribute for Shefali Jariwala from pet SimbaParag Tyagi posted a video collage of Shefali Jariwala with Simba, capturing their cherished moments together after a month of the actor's death.

Saiyaara box office Day 9: Ahaan-Aneet's love story becomes year's 2nd biggest hitMohit Suri's romantic drama 'Saiyaara', featuring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has raced into the Rs 200 crore club, collecting Rs 217.25 crore in India in just nine days.

War 2: How much Jr NTR and Hrithik Roshan are earning for Ayan Mukerji's filmWith excitement at an all-time high for 'War 2', fans would be eager to know how much Jr NTR and Hrithik Roshan earned for their role in Ayan Mukerji's upcoming action-entertainer.

Kajol opens up on cosmetic surgery, says it's a personal choice not to be judgedActor Kajol opened up about cosmetic surgery and aging, calling both personal choices that shouldn't be judged. She said aging is a privilege and not something to fear, adding that men also undergo cosmetic procedures just like women.

general news.headline: 2 dead, over 40 injured after electric shock triggers stampede at UP templeTwo people lost their lives and several others were injured in a stampede-like situation at a temple in Uttar Pradesh after an electric wire fell on a tin shed.

Efforts went in vain: Mallikarjun Kharge rues missing out on Karnataka top jobSuggesting his hopes of rising to become the Karnataka Chief Minister in 1999 suffered a setback, Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge said he worked tirelessly as the Congress Legislative Party (CLP) leader for five years, but all his efforts went in vain.

Defiant India script historic Manchester draw, keep Test series aliveIndia vs England: Washington Sundar and Ravindra Jadeja carried forward the grit shown by Shubman Gill and KL Rahul, as India summoned every ounce of resolve to script a draw that felt as improbable at dawn as it looked inevitable by dusk - keeping the series alive in a manner few could have foreseen.

Remove non-biological PM too: Trinamool MP's taunt amid Bihar poll roll revisionTrinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee taunts PM Modi over his spiritual birth claim amid Bihar voter list revision row. The opposition alleges the BJP's SIR exercise aims to disenfranchise voters ahead of assembly elections.

Can India unite for its biggest war?The target is clear. India needs to be Viksit Bharat by 2047. But half of the second decade of this century is over like the two before. To make up for the lost decades, India needs to grow faster to be counted among high-income nations. AI is now challenging the very sector on which India grew for two decades. It's the time for reforms at a war-footing and manufacturing, not consents and dissents, but what the world needs. Because, for Indians, it is now or never.

When terror walks free: 7/11 verdict and crisis of India's criminal justice systemNearly 20 years after the 7/11 Mumbai blasts, the High Court's sweeping acquittals expose alarming gaps in India's criminal justice and national security frameworks.

US, EU seal trade framework with 15% tariff to end standoffThe new trade deal sets a 15% tariff on EU goods entering the US, avoiding a steeper 30% rate. The announcement came after Trump met European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in Scotland.

How CJI, law minister blamed each other in a single day over appointment of judgesCJI B.R. Gavai, on July 24, pointed to the government stalling appointments. The very day, minister Arjun Meghwal told Parliament over half the high court vacancies lacked nominations from collegiums

3 dead, several injured as train carrying over 100 derails in GermanyThe force of the derailment was so strong that parts of the train were thrown off the tracks and into the surrounding forest. One of the carriages was seen lying on its side, with its roof torn open.

14,000 men receive payout under Ladki Bahin scheme, Ajit Pawar vows actionWhile Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar has promised to recover the amount and take action against the fraudsters, the opposition has sought a CBI probe into it.

Their decision to continue batting led to both players scoring centuries, intensifying England's disappointment.

India Today impact: Rights body acts on illegal madrasas along India-Nepal borderThe NHRC has swung into action following India Today's expose on illegal madrasas near the India-Nepal border. The investigation shed light on radical indoctrination and unregulated foreign funding posing security risks.

From death certificate to marriage certificate: Journey of HIV-positive IndiansBeing declared HIV-positive was akin to a death sentence in India of the 1990s. With new medicines, lifespan is not an issue any more. And now, more and more HIV-positive individuals are getting married, and having healthy kids. Matrimonial sites have launched sections focused on HIV+ individuals. This is how science and activism have turned stigma into happily-ever-after stories.

162 trips abroad, 25 shell firms, Rs 300 crore scam: Fake envoy's web of deceitAccording to officials, Harshvardhan Jain visited the UAE 54 times and the UK 22 times between 2005 and 2015. The probe also uncovered 25 shell companies linked to Jain in foreign countries.

How Rajendra I Chola became ruler of the seas and led an expedition to far EastUnlike the Indian rulers, Rajendra I Chola ventured to conquer foreign soil. During his rule, he defeated the rulers of Southeast Asia and conquered parts of present-day Indonesia, Thailand, Myanmar, and Sumatra. He led the naval expedition, and India has a Navy training ship named TS Rajendra in his honour. The Chola Empire under him became one of the wealthiest empires of the time, developing connections with Song China in the east and the Arabs in the west.

Injured Rishabh Pant ruled out of 5th Test, N Jagadeesan named replacementRishabh Pant has been ruled out of the fifth Test after scans confirmed a fractured metatarsal in his right foot, sustained during the fourth Test in Manchester. In his absence, Tamil Nadu wicketkeeper-batter Narayan Jagadeesan has been drafted into the squad for the series finale at The Oval.

sports.headline: Bruised, but battle-ready: Ben Stokes says he won't miss Oval Test deciderEngland captain Ben Stokes opened up on his availability for the last Test of the five-match series against India at the Oval. Stokes was adjudged Player of the Match in the fourth Test for scoring a century and taking a five-wicket haul after India secured a hard-fought draw on Day 5.

Watch: Coach Gambhir blasts critics in fiery press conference after Manchester Test drawEngland vs India: Gautam Gambhir was at his typically combative best after India eked out a heroic draw in the Manchester Test. From tearing into critics of Shubman Gill to emphasising that India would head into the fifth Test in London with confidence, Gambhir was characteristically straightforward and fiery on Sunday, 27 July.

Gambhir made the remarks after Rishabh Pant fractured his toe on the first day of the fourth Test against England in Manchester.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
